alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 14 at 4:22PM AKST until December 16 at 4:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 PM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Wind chills to 55 below expected tonight and Wednesday. Snow and blowing snow with low visibility expected Wednesday afternoon through Thursday. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches are expected. Visibility will be one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley. * WHEN...9 PM today to 4 PM Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Dangerously cold wind chills to 55 below zero will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin tonight and Wednesday. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph Wednesday afternoon through Thursday will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow with low visibility. Travel will be difficult Wednesday afternoon through Thursday. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for snow and blowing snow means periods of snow and blowing snow will cause travel difficulties.
